candidates.title: Replace outdated URLs with new targets
candidates.body:
Hello!

I've noticed that the content of the [URL that is printed](https://github.com/crev-dev/cargo-crev/blob/master/cargo-crev/src/main.rs#L82) when generating a new ID with invalid parameters (e.g. `cargo crev id new`) [has been moved](https://github.com/dpc/crev/wiki/Proof-Repository).

I've updated the URL with [the new one](https://github.com/crev-dev/crev/wiki/Proof-Repository) and also all other occurences where `github.com/dpc/crev` forwards to `github.com/crev-dev/cargo-crev`.

If the changes are made aren't wanted or needed for whatever reason, feel free to just close this pull request.

Checklist:

* [✔] `cargo +nightly fmt --all` (!!! also formatted [code I didn't touch](https://github.com/crev-dev/cargo-crev/commit/6ae38151cb78005527f5ebdb3a3017dd99126b23), see the `use` statements)
* [✘] Modify `CHANGELOG.md` if applicable (not sure if this qualifies as a 

Best,
ambiso

candidates.title: Pin ed25519-dalek
candidates.body:
This allows users to use `cargo install cargo-crev` (without `--locked`).

Checklist:

candidates.title: Towards proof Content as a trait
candidates.body:
This doesn't currently compile. I didn't realize that this change would have to be so large.

I'm not sure how to deal with these traits:
`fn parse(s: &str) -> Result<Self>`
`fn parse_draft(&self, s: &str) -> Result<Self>`

They can't seem to be accessed from a trait object.

@dpc What do you think I should do?


Checklist:

* [ ] `cargo +nightly fmt --all`
* [ ] Modify `CHANGELOG.md` if applicable

candidates.title: Terminal UI for "verify deps"
candidates.body:
This new behavior is hidden behind the --interactive flag:

    cargo crev verify -i

The application is always responsive, it can be quited with ctrl-q and the table can be scrolled.

It's not the final state, but it's already usable without (known) regression.

Once it's merged, my intent is to work on those points:

- a bunch of cosmetic and ergonomic improvements
- maybe alphabetical sort of crates by default 
- fuzzy filter/search (similar to broot)
- mouse (and keyboard?) sorting on various columns, hints on column meaning
- comment the code
- an help page
- selection, crate detailed view

And later my hope is that this could be used to launch crate related actions. And of course work on extending the TUI to other problems, like looking at reviews or at the trust trees.

candidates.title: Replace argonautica with rust-argon2
candidates.body: To drop the dependency on clang/LLVM stuff

candidates.title: Parallelize part of verify deps
candidates.body:
It goes from 13s to 5s for the whole program execution on the crev repository.

```
time cargo crev verify deps
real	0m13,009s
user	0m13,105s
sys	0m0,752s

time ../target/release/cargo-crev crev verify deps
real	0m5,069s
user	0m13,192s
sys	0m0,739s

```
Most of the gain comes from executing in parallel the geiger counts.

This PR brings also a big refactoring to separate the verification process from its display (one of the goals being to then improve the display)

candidates.title: Remove extern crates
candidates.body:
Remove all `extern crate`s and `use` macros instead. This is how for example `serde` seem to recommend doing it (https://serde.rs/derive.html).

While there, visit all `Cargo.toml` `[dependencies]` and remove what's not used anymore and sort the remaining.

Checklist:

* [X] `cargo +nightly fmt --all`
* [ ] Modify `CHANGELOG.md` if applicable

candidates.title: Update dependencies
candidates.body: Updating dependencies required minor tweaks to some parts of the code. These are committed separately for easier review. Rest of the dependencies are updated in one commit.

candidates.title: Move from `app_dirs` to `directories`.
candidates.body:
As `app_dirs` is not maintained anymore (see https://github.com/AndyBarron/app-dirs-rs) and as seen [here](https://github.com/dpc/crev/issues/125) there are some issues with config and cache paths on Windows, we should move to a more maintained alternative.

I would like to propose [`directories`](https://crates.io/crates/directories) which is still actively developed.

This has the following effects:
- On Windows `Dawid Ci,281,,380,arkiewicz` will change to `Dawid Ciężarkiewic`.
- On MacOS `Application Support/crev` will change to `Preferences/dev.Dawid-Ciężarkiewic.crev`.

I did not test it on MacOS, it would be appreciated if somebody did.

Also I removed `APP_INFO` completly, is a global similar to it needed?

Fixes #125.

candidates.title: Refactor recursive-digest
candidates.body: Improve error handling using `failure` and general refactor.
